message.content:
cs.CY, cs.CL, cs.HC, cs.LG, cs.IR. 

The paper discusses a framework for improving peer assessment on MOOCs, which involves identifying peers and aligning incentives to drive high-quality feedback. This involves aspects of computational social science (cs.CY) in terms of understanding how individuals interact in online learning environments, natural language processing (cs.CL) in terms of analyzing the feedback provided by peers, human-computer interaction (cs.HC) in terms of designing the framework for peer assessment, machine learning (cs.LG) in terms of potentially using algorithms to assist with the assessment process, and information retrieval (cs.IR) in terms of potentially using techniques to match students with appropriate peers for assessment.
